inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: CT scan showed evidence of acute perforated appendicitis with free fluid in the pelvis, but diagnostic laparoscopy revealed phlegmon with no other abdominal abnormalities.

inclusion.criterion: Ability to give consent to participate in the study
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: He is now a candidate for emergent laparoscopic appendectomy under general anesthesia.

exclusion.criterion: Age under 18 years or over 60 years
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Allergy to contrast media or iodine
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Allergy or contraindication to antibiotic therapy
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Severe systemic illness (for example malignancy, medical condition requiring immunosuppressant medication)
exclusion.label: unknown
not_met
exclusion.evidence: CT scan showed evidence of acute perforated appendicitis with free fluid in the pelvis, but diagnostic laparoscopy revealed phlegmon with no other abdominal abnormalities.

exclusion.criterion: Inability to co-operate and give informed consent
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient is a 17-year-old boy with severe migratory pain in the right lower quadrant of his abdomen, accompanied by nausea and vomiting. He has been diagnosed with acute perforated appendicitis and is now a candidate for emergent laparoscopic appendectomy under general anesthesia.
